--- title: "Aesthetic mappings" author: "Claus O. Wilke" date: last-modified format: revealjs: theme: - default - Wilke-theme.scss auto-stretch: false chalkboard: true execute: fig-format: svg fig-asp: 0.618 fig-width: 5.5 --- # Plots map data onto graphical elements ## Dataset:
Daily average temperatures for various locations ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
location day_of_year month temperature
Death Valley 1 01 51.0
Death Valley 2 01 51.2
Death Valley 3 01 51.3
Death Valley 4 01 51.4
Death Valley 5 01 51.6
Death Valley 6 01 51.7
Death Valley 7 01 51.9
Death Valley 8 01 52.0
Death Valley 9 01 52.2
Death Valley 10 01 52.3
Death Valley 11 01 52.5
Death Valley 12 01 52.7
Death Valley 13 01 52.9
````` ::: ::: ::: ## Temperatures mapped onto y position ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/temp-normals-vs-time-1.svg){width=80%} ::: ::: ## Temperatures mapped onto color ::: {.move-down-1em} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/four-locations-temps-by-month-1.svg){width=100%} ::: ::: ::: ## Commonly used aesthetics ![](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/aesthetic_mapping_files/figure-html/common-aesthetics-1.png){width=90% fig-align="center"} ## The same data values can be mapped to different aesthetics ![](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/aesthetic_mapping_files/figure-html/basic-scales-example-1.png){width=90% fig-align="center"} ## We can use many different aesthetics at once ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/mtcars-five-scale-1.svg){width=70%} ::: ::: # Creating aesthetic mappings in ggplot ## Getting the data All examples will use the `temperatures` dataset: ::: {.smaller-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} temperatures <- read_csv("https://wilkelab.org/SDS366/datasets/tempnormals.csv") |> mutate( location = factor( location, levels = c("Death Valley", "Houston", "San Diego", "Chicago") ) ) |> select(location, station_id, day_of_year, month, temperature) ``` ::: ::: ## We define the mapping with `aes()` ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot( data = temperatures, mapping = aes(x = day_of_year, y = temperature, color = location) ) + geom_line() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-temps-example-1.svg){width=65%} ::: ::: ::: ## We define the mapping with `aes()` ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot( data = temperatures, mapping = aes(x = day_of_year, y = location, color = temperature) ) + geom_point(size = 5) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-temps-example2-1.svg){width=85%} ::: ::: ::: ## We frequently omit argument names Long form, all arguments are named: ::: {.small-font} ```r ggplot( data = temperatures, mapping = aes(x = day_of_year, y = location, color = temperature) ) + geom_point(size = 5) ``` ::: ::: {.fragment .move-down-1em} Abbreviated form, common arguments remain unnamed: ::: {.small-font} ```r ggplot(temperatures, aes(day_of_year, location, color = temperature)) + geom_point(size = 5) ``` ::: ::: ## The geom determines how the data is shown ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(day_of_year, temperature, color = location)) + geom_line() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-temps-example5-1.svg){width=65%} ::: ::: ::: ## The geom determines how the data is shown ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(day_of_year, location, color = temperature)) + geom_point(size = 5) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-temps-example6-1.svg){width=85%} ::: ::: ::: ## The geom determines how the data is shown ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, color = location)) + geom_boxplot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-temps-example7-1.svg){width=75%} ::: ::: ::: ## The geom determines how the data is shown ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, fill = location)) + geom_violin() + facet_wrap(~location) # make separate panel per location ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-temps-example8-1.svg){width=90%} ::: ::: ::: # Important: Distinguish between `color` and `fill` ## Distinguish between `color` and `fill` ::: {.move-down-1em} `color`
Applies color to points, lines, text, borders ::: ::: {.fragment .move-down-1em} `fill`
Applies color to any filled areas ::: ## Many geoms use both `color` and `fill` ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, color = location)) + geom_boxplot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-color-fill-1.svg){width=75%} ::: ::: ::: ## Many geoms use both `color` and `fill` ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, fill = location)) + geom_boxplot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-color-fill2-1.svg){width=75%} ::: ::: ::: ## Many geoms use both `color` and `fill` ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, color = location, fill = location)) + geom_boxplot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-color-fill3-1.svg){width=75%} ::: ::: ::: ## Aesthetics can also be used as parameters ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, fill = location)) + geom_boxplot(color = "steelblue") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-color-fill-params-1.svg){width=75%} ::: ::: ::: ## Aesthetics can also be used as parameters ::: {.small-font} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(temperatures, aes(month, temperature, color = location)) + geom_boxplot(fill = "steelblue") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![ ](aesthetic-mappings_files/figure-revealjs/ggplot-color-fill-params2-1.svg){width=75%} ::: ::: ::: ## Further reading - Fundamentals of Data Visualization: [Chapter 2: Visualizing data](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/aesthetic-mapping.html) - Data Visualizationâ€”A Practical Introduction: [Chapter 3: Make a plot](https://socviz.co/makeplot.html#makeplot) - [**ggplot2** reference documentation](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/index.html) - [**ggplot2** book](https://ggplot2-book.org/) - [**ggplot2** cheatsheet](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/main/data-visualization.pdf)

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
